Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Invited handbook chapter 'Logically Possible Worlds and Counterpart Semantics for Modal Logic'. Handbook of the Philosophy of Logic, edited by Dale Jacquette, Volume 5 of the Handbook of the Philosophy of Science, edited by Dov Gabbay, Paul Thagard, and John Woods, Elsevier, 943-996, 2007.

Reviewer for the following leading international Journals and Conferences (excluding PC memberships listed elsewhere): Journals: Review of Symbolic Logic (RSL), Journal of Symbolic Logic (JSL), Journal of Data Semantics (JODS), Journal of Logic and Computation (JLC) Journal of Artificial Intelligence Research (JAIR), Journal of Biomedical Semantics (JBMS), Studia Logica (SL), Spatial Cognition and Computation, Applied Ontology (AOJ), Journal of Data & Knowledge Engineering (DKE), Logic Journal of the Interest Group in Pure and Applied Logics (IGPL), Journal of Applied Non-Classical Logics (JANCL), Bulletin of The Section of Logic (BSL), amongst others. Conferences: Logic in Computer Science (CSL), Conference on Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR), Methods for Modalities (M4M), European Conference on Artificial Intelligence (ECAI), Conference on Logic for Programming Artificial Intelligence and Reasoning (LPAR), Algebraic Methodology and Software Technology (AMAST), Frontiers of Combining Systems (FroCos), International Conference on Artificial Intelligence: Methodology, Systems, Applications (AIMSA), International Workshop on Description Logics (DL), Conference on Ana- lytic Tableaux and Related Methods (TABLEAUX), Conference on Automated De- duction (CADE), Advances in Modal Logic (AiML), amongst others.

Edited three volumes in the IOS Press series 'Frontiers in Artificial Intelligence and Applications'. (1) Formal Ontology in Information Systems: Proceedings of the Eighth International Conference (FOIS 2014); (2) Modular Ontologies: Proc. of the Fifth International Workshop (WoMO 2011); (3) Modular Ontologies: Proc. of the Fourth International Workshop (WoMO 2010).
Guest Editor, Applied Ontology, 2010/11, Special Issue on ‘Modular Ontologies’ of the International Journal of Applied Ontology, IOS Press, with Joana Hois (Bremen).
Joined the Editorial Board of the Journal of Applied Ontology (IOS Press) in 2015. http://www.iospress.nl/journal/applied-ontology/?tab=editorial-board
Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy, invited article on 'Formal Ontology', forthcoming. See http://www.collegepublications.co.uk/eol/ http://www.jyb-logic.org/iep.html

Guest Editor, Applied Ontology, 2017, Special Issue on ‘FOUST: The Foundational Stance - An overview of foundational ontologies’ of the International Journal of Applied Ontology, IOS Press, with Stefano Borgo (Trento).

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Speaker at dozens of international conferences and workshops since 2000 (see conference/workshop publications list); highlights include: KR, ECAI, FOIS, IJCAI, AiML, ESSLLI, etc. (Invited talks are listed separately)

Programme Committee Member in more than 50 international conferences and workshops, including the following: AGI-16, FOIS-16, KR-16, LRCM-16, DL-16, ESWC-16, AIC-15, AIDE-15, IWOOD-15, C3GI-15, DL-15, ESWC-15, CiE-15, AIC-14, ECAI-14, ODLS-14, C3GI-14, AGI-14, AIMSA-14, IJCAI-13, LRCM-13, ARCOE-13, ODLS-13, AGI-13, Formal Magic 13, AAAI-13, C3GI-13, ECAI-12, ARCOE-12, AIMSA-12, STAIRS-12, ESWC-12, KI-12, ISWC-11, OCAS-11, IJCAI-11, NLPCS-11, CTUW-11, IICAI-11, STAIRS-10, KR-10, ECAI-10, AAAI-10, NLPCS-10, OWLED-09, IICAI-09, DL-09, IJCAI-09, NLPCS-09, AIMSA-08, WORM-08, WoMO-08, WoMO-07, OnE-07
Co-organiser of WoMO-06, First International Workshop on Modular Ontologies, co-located with the International Semantic Web Conference (ISWC-06), Athens, Georgia, November 2006.

Co-organiser (PC chair), WoMO-10 (4th International Workshop on Modular Ontologies), held in Toronto, Canada, May 11, 2010. Co-located with the 6th International Conference on Formal Ontology in Information Systems, FOIS 2010.

Invited Lecturer: ESSLLI 2010 (22nd European Summer School in Logic, Language and Information, Copenhagen, August 9–20, 2010) advanced course entitled ‘Proof Complexity of Non-Classical Logics’ (with Olaf Beyersdorff, University of Leeds)
Invited Speaker: Symposium on Ontology between Philosophy and Computer Science (14th Congress of Logic, Methodology and Philosophy of Science, Nancy, July 19–26, 2011)
Co-organiser (PC chair), WoMO-11 (5th International Workshop on Modular Ontologies, co-located with ESSLLI-2011, Ljubljana, Slovenia, August 1–12, 2011.)
Co-organiser (PC chair), SHAPES 1.0 (The Shape of Things), co-located with Context-2011, Karlsruhe, Germany, September 27, 2011.
Invited Speaker: OASIS Symposium at ISWC 2011, Bonn, Germany.
Invited tutorial on ‘E-Connections for Spatial Modelling’ at the 4th Indian School on Logic and its Applications, Manipal University, India, January 9–20, 2012.
Invited Speaker: 3rd World Congress on the Square of Opposition, Beirut, Lebanon, June 26–29, 2012.
Invited Tutorial on ‘Connecting Logics’, 4th World Congress and School on Universal Logic, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, March 29–April 7, 2013.
Co-organiser (PC chair), SHAPES 2.0, co-located with the 4th World Congress and School on Universal Logic, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, March 29–April 7, 2013
Co-chair and Advisory Committee for the 2014 Ontology Summit on Big Data and Semantic Web Meets Applied Ontology (Track G).
Co-organiser, SQUARE IV - 4th World Congress on the Square of Opposition, Pontifical Laterian University, Vatican City, Rome, Italy, May 5–9, 2014.
Invited Speaker: Computational Creativity, Concept Invention, and General Intelligence, Workshop at ECAI 2014, 19th of August, 2014, Prague, Czech Republic.
PC chair, FOIS-2014 (8th International Conference on Formal Ontology in Information Systems), Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, 2014.

Organiser and PC Chair of the 1st workshop on Formal Ontologies for Artificial Intelligence, FOfAI 2015, held at IJCAI 2015 in Buenos Aires. FOfAI was a participant in the Joint Ontology Workshops - JOWO 2015.
Co-Organiser of the Image Schema Day: Vol I, October 2, Bolzano, Italy. Invited talks by John Bateman (Bremen), Nicola Guarino (Trento), and Tony Veale (Dublin).

Organiser and PC Chair of SHAPES 3.0 – The Shape of Things, held in conjunction with the Ninth International and Interdisciplinary Conference on Modeling and Using Context, CONTEXT 2015, Larnaca, Cyprus, 2–6 November 2015.

Invited tutorial on ‘Computational Analogy-Making, Concept Blending, and Related Forms of Non-Classical Reasoning’ at the FIERCES ON BICA 2016: First International Early Research Career Enhancement School on Biologically Inspired Cognitive Architectures.
General Chair, ISAO 2016: 3rd Interdisciplinary School on Applied Ontology, Bozen- Bolzano, June 27–July 1, 2016.

General Chair of JOWO, the Joint Ontology Workshops 2016, and Workshop Chair of FOIS-16, held at the 9th International Conference on Formal Ontology in Information Systems (FOIS 2016) held in Annecy, France, between July 6–9, 2016.
Organiser of the International Workshop ‘New Standards for the Working Ontologist: Common Logic and DOL’ (NSWO-16), held at JOWO-16, Annecy, France, as part of FOIS 2016.
Organiser of the First International Workshop on Cognition And OntologieS (CAOS-16), held at JOWO-16, Annecy, France, as part of FOIS 2016.
ESSLLI 2016 Lecturer. Course on ‘The Distributed Ontology Language DOL’ (with Till Mossakowski).
Co-Organiser of the 5th Computational Creativity, Concept Invention, and General Intelligence (C3GI 2016), collocated with ESSLLI 2016, August 20–22, 2016, Bozen-Bolzano, Italy
Co-Organiser of the Image Schema Day: Vol II, August 22, Bolzano, Italy. Invited talks by Tim Fernando (Dublin), John Bateman (Bremen), Stefano Borgo (Trento), and Brian Magerko (Georgia Tech).
Convenor: From Computational Creativity to Creativity Science. An International Conference at the ZiF Centre for Interdisciplinary Research, 19–22 September 2016, Bielefeld, Germany.
Organiser of the Second International Workshop on Cognition And OntologieS (CAOS-17), to be held at AISB-17,18-21th April 2017, University of Bath.
Organiser of the FOUST 2017 symposium 'The Foundational Stance' - consolidating foundational ontology research. Bolzano, February 2017.
General Chair, FOIS-2018: 10th International Conference on Formal Ontology in Information Systems, 2018.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Member of the advisory committee for the 1st meeting of the IAOA Design Semantics SIG, Bari, Italy, 2014.
Co-chair and Advisory Committee for the 2014 Ontology Summit on Big Data and Semantic Web Meets Applied Ontology (Track G).
Co-chair, IAOA, since 2010 co-heading the permanent committee on “Infrastructure” of the International Association of Applied Ontology.

Co-project leader (with Till Mossakowski, Michael Grüninger) and Named Expert of DIN, ISO NP 17347 (OntoIOp), OMG standardisation initiative concerning “Ontology Integration and Interoperability: The Distributed Ontology Language (DOL)” Officially adopted by OMG in 2016.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Founding member of the International Association for Ontology and its Applications (IAOA), and elected member and currently Vice-President of the IAOA Executive Council.
2011 2nd prize, Deep Knowledge Representation Challenge, DKR-11, Banff, Alberta, Canada (with Janna Hastings and Till Mossakowski). https://sites.google.com/site/dkrckcap2011/program
2012 FOIS Best Paper Award (with Till Mossakowski and Christoph Lange).
2013 IJCAI Best paper sister conferences track (with Till Mossakowski and Christoph Lange).

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Advanced courses targeting mostly doctoral students at the European Summer School on Logic, Language, and Information, namely at ESSLLI 2009, ESSLLI 2010 and ESSLLI 2016.
2010–12 Phd Supervision of Tzu-Keng Fu at University of Bremen; thesis title ‘Logical Pluralism and the Geography of Thought’, defended in July 2012.

2010 Recognition of “habilitationsäquivalente Leistungen als ‘Wissenschaftler in herausgehobener Position’ ” (recognition of habilitation-equivalent performance in order to supervise german PhD students): general teaching and examination authority, University of Bremen.
2011 President of the PhD Qualifying Examination Committee, January 2011. ICT Doctoral School, University of Trento (4 PhD students);
Phd supervision of Maria Magdalena Heblom at University of Magdeburg (2015) and University of Bolzano (2016).
Member of the Doctoral School, University of Bozen-Bolzano, since April 2015.
General Chair, ISAO 2016: 3rd Interdisciplinary School on Applied Ontology, Bozen- Bolzano, June 27–July 1, 2016.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: 2009-2014 Lecturing (‘Lehrauftrag’) at the Departments of Computer Science, Philosophy & Linguistics, and Digital Media; courses on ‘Vagueness in Language and Logic’ and ‘Information Flow and the Logic of Distributed Systems’, amongst others.

ESSLLI 2009 (21st European Summer School in Logic, Language and Information, Bordeaux, July 20–31, 2009) advanced course entitled ‘Ontologies: Structuring, Modularity, and Heterogeneity’ (with Stefano Borgo (Trento) and Till Mossakowski (Magdeburg))

ESSLLI 2010 (22nd European Summer School in Logic, Language and Information, Copenhagen, August 9–20, 2010) advanced course entitled ‘Proof Complexity of Non-Classical Logics’ (with Olaf Beyersdorff, University of Leeds)
2011/12 Lectures on ‘From Syllogism to Common Sense: A Tour through the Logical Landscape’ at University of Bremen (Philosophy/Computer Science/Mathematics Departments);
Invited tutorial on ‘E-Connections for Spatial Modelling’ at the 4th Indian School on Logic and its Applications, Manipal University, India, January 9–20, 2012.
Invited Tutorial on ‘Connecting Logics’, 4th World Congress and School on Universal Logic, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, March 29–April 7, 2013

2014/15 Lecturing at the Department of Computer Science, Otto-von-Guericke University of Magdeburg: courses on ‘Applied Ontology’ and ‘Computational Creativity’ (Summer); advanced lecture on description logics and student research project (Winter).
Lecturer in the European Master Program on Computational Logic (EMCL), hosted at universities in Dresden, Vienna, Lisbon, and Bolzano.

April 2016 Invited tutorial on ‘Computational Analogy-Making, Concept Blending, and Related Forms of Non-Classical Reasoning’ at the FIERCES ON BICA 2016: First International Early Research Career Enhancement School on Biologically Inspired Cognitive Architectures.
ISAO 2016: 3rd Interdisciplinary School on Applied Ontology, Bozen-Bolzano, June 27 – July 1, 2016. General Chair and Coordinator of Scientific Program.
ESSLLI 2016 Lecturer. Course on ‘The Distributed Ontology Language DOL’ (with Till Mossakowski).

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Deutsche Vereinigung für Mathematische Logik und für Grundlagen der Exakten Wissenschaften (‘German Association for Mathematical Logic and for the Foundations of the Exact Sciences’) (DVMLG). Member since 2000.
Association for Symbolic Logic (ASL). Member since 2000
Association Computability in Europe (CiE). Member since 2008.
Founding Member, IAOA, 2009. The International Association of Ontology and its Applications was formally established in Trento in 2009.
Australasian Association for Logic, Member since 2010.
Co-chair, IAOA, since 2010 co-heading the permanent committee on “Infrastructure” of the International Association of Applied Ontology.

Co-project leader (with Till Mossakowski, Michael Grüninger) and Named Expert of DIN, ISO NP 17347 (OntoIOp), OMG standardisation initiative concerning “Ontology Integration and Interoperability: The Distributed Ontology Language (DOL)” Officially adopted by OMG in 2016.
Deutsche Gesellschaft für Informatik (GI). Member since 2012.
Member of the Steering Committee of WoMO (since 2012), the Workshop series on Modular Ontologies.
Elected to the Executive Council of the IAOA, the International Association for Ontology and its Applications, July 2012, re-elected September 2013.
Elected Vice-President of the IAOA, the International Association for Ontology and its Applications, January 2015.
Association for Computational Creativity. Member since 2016.
Association Neural-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning (NeSy). Member since 2016.

September 2016 LUNA 2016: participation in the Long Night of Science (LUNA 2016), presenting the outcomes of the COINVENT project concerning computational creativity research to the general public, Bozen-Bolzano, September 30.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Research Assistant, DFG-project ‘Combination of Modal and Description Logics for the Representation of Intensional and Dynamical Knowledge’, Intelligent Systems Department, Leipzig, Germany.
Research Assistant, Logic and Computation Group, Department of Computer Science, University of Liverpool, UK.
Postdoctoral Research Associate, EPSRC project ‘Extending Expressive Description Logics’, University of Manchester, School of Computer Science, Information Management Group, UK.
Spatial Cognition Research Center, Bremen University, 2007-2014. co-PI of Spaceportal/Ontohub projects, lecturer and researcher.

Co-project leader (with Till Mossakowski, Michael Grüninger) and Named Expert of DIN, ISO NP 17347 (OntoIOp), OMG standardisation initiative concerning “Ontology Integration and Interoperability: The Distributed Ontology Language (DOL)” Officially adopted by OMG in 2016. Final OMG standard for DOL coming in early 2017. http://www.omg.org/spec/DOL/
Advisory Committee for the 2013 Ontology Summit. http://ontolog.cim3.net/cgi-bin/wiki.pl?OntologySummit2013
Co-chair and Advisory Committee for the 2014 Ontology Summit on Big Data and Semantic Web Meets Applied Ontology (Track G).
Member of the advisory committee for the 1st meeting of the IAOA Design Semantics SIG, Bari, Italy, 2014.
Principal Investigator, FP7 Concept Invention Theory (COINVENT) project. Theoretical Computer Science group (Formal Methods and Semantics), Otto-von-Guericke University of Magdeburg, Germany.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: 2002 Co-authored the grant proposal for the second phase of the DFG project ‘Combination of Modal and Description Logics for the Representation of Intensional and Dynamical Knowledge’, 2003–2004. ca 150K
2010 Co-authored the I1-[OntoSpace] grant proposal for the third phase of the Research Center on Spatial Cognition SFB/TR 8 (2011–2014). ca 300K
2011 SFB/TR 8 funding for WoMO 2011 and book publication (Ljubljana, Slovenia) as well as SHAPES 1.0 (Karlsruhe, Germany).
2012 PI, OntoHub/OntoIOp Project, SFB/TR 8 Funding (Euro 25473 awarded);

2013 Funding for Shapes 2.0: 15.000 R$ awarded by CAPES – Coordination for the im- provement of Higher-level Personnel; and 5.000 R$ awarded by the National Council for Scientific and Technological Development (CNPq).
2013 PI, SpacePortal Project, University of Bremen funding; (awarded Euro 29723).
2014–16 Principal Investigator: EU Collaborative Project COINVENT (‘Concept Invention Theory’) (ICT STREP, 7 partner institutions, 450K funding for Magdeburg/Bolzano, 2.7 Million Euro total
2015 PI, CIAO project ‘Concept Invention and Applied Ontology’; 10K, Free University of Bozen-Bolzano.
2016/17 PI, RTD LOGIS project, ‘The Logic of Image Schemas’; 20K, Free University of Bozen-Bolzano.
2016 C3GI 2016 and Image Schema Day II, co-funded by UNIBZ, 2.5k http://www.inf.unibz.it/~okutz/events/images16.html
2016/18 PI, Computational Technologies for Concept Invention (CoCo), CRC call 2016. 70K Euros

Risultati ottenuti nel trasferimento tec.content: Co-project leader of the OMG standardisation initiative “OntoIOp” concerning heterogeneous ontology integration and interoperability (DOL language), formally adopted in 2016. A global effort with currently over 40 experts involved worldwide. Final OMG standard is expected in early 2017. Industrial launchpads for EU funding for industrial take-up are under review. Further industrial outreach is under way, in particular in cooperation with the newly founded Data Factory at Uni Bolzano to connect academia with industry.

LUNA 2016: participation in the Long Night of Science (LUNA 2016), presenting the outcomes of the COINVENT project concerning computational cre- ativity research to the general public, Bozen-Bolzano, September 30.
